intro: Guatteria spatulata, commonly known as the spatulate guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its broad, spatulate leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature, attracting various wildlife species. Guatteria spatulata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is also valued in traditional medicine.
